meanings.definition: The action of forcing someone to leave a place.
meanings.sent1: The expulsion of the student from the classroom was necessary for the safety of others.
meanings.sent2: The expulsion of air from the balloon made it deflate quickly.
meanings.sent3: The expulsion of the mischievous squirrel from the garden led to a peaceful afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The expulsion of toxins from the body is essential for good health.
meanings.sent5: The expulsion of the intruder from the building was swift and decisive.

meanings.definition: The process of removing something from a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The expulsion of dust from the room made it much cleaner.
meanings.sent2: The expulsion of the old furniture from the house created more space.
meanings.sent3: The expulsion of the last slice of cake from the plate left everyone wanting more.
meanings.sent4: The expulsion of negative thoughts from the mind can lead to a happier life.
meanings.sent5: The expulsion of the unwanted guests from the party improved the atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The act of ejecting or driving out.
meanings.sent1: The sudden expulsion of water from the pipe caused a flood in the basement.
meanings.sent2: The expulsion of the ball from the cannon was powerful and impressive.
meanings.sent3: The expulsion of the loud burp from the quiet room startled everyone.
meanings.sent4: The expulsion of the rebellious ideas from the meeting was met with disapproval.
meanings.sent5: The expulsion of the smoke from the chimney signaled that the fire was burning brightly.
